contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Two ships in the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''USS ''Thomas''''' for [[Clarence Crase Thomas]]: * [[USS Thomas (DD-182)|''Thomas'' (DD-182)]], a [[Wickes class destroyer|''Wickes''-class]] [[destroyer]], launched in 1918 and transferred to the [[Royal Navy]] as [[HMS St. Albans|HMS ''St. Albans'']] in 1940. *[[USS Thomas (DE-102)|''Thomas'' (DE-102)]], a [[Cannon class destroyer escort|''Cannon''-class]] [[destroyer escort]], launched in 1943, and transferred to [[Taiwan]] in 1946. Also, the [[USS Thomas (1894)|USS ''Thomas'']] (or ''S.S. Thomas''), a converted cattle ship, transported the [[Thomasites|Thomasite]] teachers from [[San Francisco]] to the [[Philippines]] in 1901. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Thomas}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
